intro: Calandrinia hirtella, commonly known as the hairy portulaca, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Portulacaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and vibrant, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to dry conditions. Its flowers are usually pink to red in color and bloom in late spring to early summer. Calandrinia hirtella is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
